Reviews.Title: Great deal for the price
Reviews.Author: Anibal
Reviews.Content: Ill be quick about this. I rated it 4 but its more of a 3.5Pros:Speed. Ram and processor live up to expectations. Windows 8 running super good, and even though im not a big fan of the OS, Im learning to deal with it. CAnt imagine what itd be like running 16gb, which it can be upgraded to.Storage. Almost a TB storage. Need I say more?Aesthetics. It looks pretty.Cons:Touchpad can be weird sometimes. It might be I have to tweak the sttings but it just doenst feel right at times.Screen could use a bit more detail, clarity...resolution? DOnt know what the term is here. DEfinitely not the sharpest or clearest screen in the marketUSB ports. With only 2 ports, I find myself wanting at least one more.So for the price? great buy, but dont expect the fanciest of laptops. Its still a decent looking machine

Reviews.Title: Great Specs for the Price
Reviews.Author: Travis H
Reviews.Content: At $499 and free shipping, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better deal on a laptop for everyday use. With 8GB of RAM, a nice I5 processor and decent sized hard drive, this is a great computer for the average user; home use, college students. My only complaint is Windows 8, but that has nothing to do with ASUS.  I've always had ASUS computers, they are built to last and are consistently rated high for the longevity of their components. And as an added bonus: it's gorgeous to look at.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for $500. Better available for a bit more now that the price is hiked. Windows 8 though...
Reviews.Author: Aditya
Reviews.Content: I've been using this machine for 3 months now. It's fast, relatively light and can handle the heavy multitasking I need (a VM, Netbeans, Eclipse for Android et al all open at the same time, while browsing several tabs).Windows 8 was horrible. It still is quite bad despite the 8.1 upgrade.I'd suggest getting the next gen edition of this laptop now though. There's one with a 4th gen i5 and 250 gb extra hdd space available for just $50 more available as I type this

Reviews.Title: I guess ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Matthew V Menke
Reviews.Content: The computer is ok, but the touch pad is a huge problem for me. It is too sensitive or doesn't work right. I also had a windows update problem where it would take forever to restart because of updating. The pc works fine when you plug a mouse in it.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy an ASUS laptop
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The hinge mechanism is faulty workmanship. I bought the laptop in August 2013. The hinge broke and because it is molded to the LCD, ASUS is expecting me to pay $165 as well as shipping ($30.00) for the repair. ASUS will not stand by its warranty even though the hinge initially broke after my owning it only 2 weeks. I have never written a negative review before. However, my frustration with ASUS is extremely high. Repeated emails from a local computer repair man, who is officially sanctioned by ASUS for repairs, have not resulted in anything. He, also, has decided to break all ties with ASUS after this incident.

Reviews.Author: Wisam TIP 46402
Reviews.Content: Eveything great only i have problem in space button it dosent work fine but the laptop is light speed and good price

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: Shirley
Reviews.Content: Love this computer! It's portable and light. Love Windows 8. My only dislike (but it's livable) is sometimes the mouse is extra sensitive but its only occasionally and doesn't bother me that much! Great battery life.

Reviews.Title: Powered by Linux
Reviews.Author: george123
Reviews.Content: Great entry level computer. The resolution is decent can run youtube vids at 720p no problem. Did not keep windows 8 too much bloat.  Dual booted Ubuntu 13.04 with no problem and all hardware works fine and Arch Linux.Great system for the money

Reviews.Title: Not as expected
Reviews.Author: Usha Rani Akkina
Reviews.Content: Performance is very slow.My older laptop with a much lesser configuration worked better than this laptopHad internet issues.Once the internet was turned off and wouldn't turn on unless I restarted the laptop.Not happy with the mouse.The mouse little jumpy.All in all I am not happy with this laptop.So I returned it

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jorge Luis Hernandez Madrid
Reviews.Content: I am Very happy with this computer, is faster and has a very nice color and made with durable materials

Reviews.Title: Excellent Casual Laptop
Reviews.Author: Drifteddy
Reviews.Content: I love the weight, dimensions, and unique case design of this laptop. Excellent monitor clarity and superb laptop speakers (who would have thought possible). I haven't tested the performance capacity, but have yet to encounter any slowing down while running several applications/music/etc. ASUS has risen above the rest.

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Great computer! Smooth OS, very fast and user friendly. Everything it was advertised to be. I highly recommend this brand to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Find another laptop
Reviews.Author: Anita L. Adams "AA"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop for our son for school in early August after researching several brands and my own experience with an Asus tablet. Unfortunately, this laptop has been a disappointment.  He's had problems with it freezing/becoming unresponsive to the point that the only way to get it working again is to do a hard reboot. After a few months, he began having problems with it sensing our wireless connection and connecting to the Internet (3 other laptops in the house connect without a problem.) After several hours "chatting" online with Asus tech support, we returned it to the manufacturer (shipping at our expense.) Repairs were supposedly made and we received it back a few days ago. Fired it up to reload everything.....and it froze....three times, requiring a hard reboot to get any type of response. Finally got everything back on (Office/Security/Pro, none of which should affect Intenet connectivity.) Once again, it will not sense the wireless connection nor connect to the Internet.Between the problems freezing the and Internet problems, it's been more trouble than it's worth and more than likely, will be the last Asus product I purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great overall laptop.
Reviews.Author: Bobby Hafler
Reviews.Content: This laptop is fantastic. The i5 proccessor is very quick, and the 8GB of RAM(upgradable to 16) is really nice for Windows 8.1. The screen looks really great also, with a matte finish to eliminate glare. The only downside, which almost isn't even worth mentioning, is the trackpad has a feature called "palmcheck" or "palmtracker". What this does is it stops you from accidentally clicking when you don't want to. Initially this seemed like a cool feature, but it's kind of annoying. When you're navigating, or playing games it could get in your way because when you press a key, the trackpad right and left click are disabled for roughly a second. This is easily combatable, you can buy a cheap little $10 USB mouse and your problem's gone. Overall though, amazing laptop.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop, great screen
Reviews.Author: T. McDonald "Tim"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a friend and he loves this a lot.  I would get one of these for myself if I was in the market.  ASUS is a great company.

Reviews.Title: A good laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: argsv
Reviews.Content: ASUS like many other PC makers ships their machines with a bunch of bloatware. The people responsible for this are out of touch.Windows 8 is actually good. I did not notice a significant change in 8.1. Restoring the Windows Start button is almost a joke. I miss hitting the Windows Logo button, seeing the start menu, few movements of the arrow keys and I am at the Documents folder, Control Panel or My Computer. Other than this Windows 8 in general is really decent.The touchscreen works well (unexpectedly which is a nice surprise). When you're reading a long page and in no mode to move hands to the mouse/touchpad, navigating by touching the screen is really nice.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Stacy J Smoker
Reviews.Content: This computer runs so much more smoothly than my Acer EVER did! My only complaint is that it has Windows 8 which I HATE! I will likely be putting 7 on soon. The sound is decent and and videos have not been choppy at all. I'm not regretting this choice :)

Reviews.Title: Good but not so much
Reviews.Author: Fabricio Gallo Paulon
Reviews.Content: I liked this laptop and it is good and fast, but i having difficulties to enter space key, only this.

Reviews.Title: Asus laptop computer mixed review
Reviews.Author: melanie H yonks
Reviews.Content: Overall I like the computer but the track pad is so sensitive that by merely resting my left wrist on the computer - it swishes the window that I am working on away and I have to search for it.  Windows 8 is probably the biggest issue as it is a totally unintuitive operating system and requires extra steps for simple functions.  You have to completely exit a document just to save it.  And while I understand this is not the computer itself, it is what is running the computer.It is not too heavy and the screen size is great.  It seems to charge pretty quickly and works well, so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer but can be a little difficult
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Rasp
Reviews.Content: So far this computer works great and I haven't had any problems. I was not familiar with windows 8 so it took me a while to some technical stuff out, like how to turn it off or find the document folder. All the apps have been great to play with when I'm bored. I play some computer games and the resolution on them are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Laptop
Reviews.Author: Stacy Cook
Reviews.Content: I love my new laptop, only if the internet connection could keep up. It linked onto my wifi with no problems along with the wireless printer which just made my life easier!

Reviews.Title: windows 8 problem
Reviews.Author: wenzhen
Reviews.Content: The laptop was good but it auto close when I go to skype. The sound was good and it really instant on my pc. Cons is only 2 usb port is available. I am really in love with this laptop despite the screen is 15.6 inches. IF you want a pc for basic use, this laptop is suitable for you.

Reviews.Title: Review on ASUS 15.6 laptop
Reviews.Author: scholar99
Reviews.Content: Laptop arrived today!I've been learning Windows 8 and figuring out everything I can with this laptop and so far it's been amazing! Terrific picture quality and great sound! Apps run smoothly, Netflix and iTunes work great! Everything I could want in a laptop for school and work. So slim and light. I've only had it for the day but so far it's everything I wanted. Great buy and Great price!! Being someone who is not very tech savvy I found this laptop easy to use and learn. Also it's so quiet when running programs and even just starting up.  I totally recommend this laptop for everyone.The CD/DVD player worked great for me and my ipod hooked up to the laptop and works great.

Reviews.Title: Alright for the price, but my last Asus was better
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: This laptop was purchased to replace a 2 year old ASUS laptop. As an aside ASUS absolutely honors their no questions asked 12 month warranty - I used it on the last one and it was painless. That's what earned this purchase when it came time to replace the laptop (I killed it - got wet).Overall the speed is what was expected, everything works as expected. That's the good.The bad:1) I HATE Windows 8, but that's not their fault.2) The touchpad is a PAIN and as far as I can tell there is no longer a way to change it's settings . . . grrrrr!!!!3) I thought only two usb ports would be good enough . . . I was wrong! Be careful of the hub you use, I bought one from walmart that didn't last 24 hours . . . again this is not ASUS's fault, but should be noted.4) The audio is absolutely NOT accurate!! I do voice over and that is what I bought this computer for. In listening back my recording sounded too bad to be acceptable and I got scared, only to find out that it's the audio coming through the jack, using my interface I heard the audio as it was recorded which was fine. Hence, if audio quality is important to you DO NOT use this laptop for that! I am not forced to use my audio interface even for my preliminary editting/QC checks. This IS ASUS's fault and frustrates me. The last one didn't have this problem.All in all, I paid about the same as I did for my last ASUS laptop, but got an inferior product to the last one. So, it's still an alright deal for the money, but leaves me a bit jaded on their value for the money!

Reviews.Title: The screen is not responding after ideal time
Reviews.Author: Viswanadha Kothagundla
Reviews.Content: We have created a request, Amazon sent a new one then we felt very happy. Unfortunately the new one did not even start, promptly returned to Amazon. I am not happy with the product overall.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: richard smith
Reviews.Content: This laptop seem to work fine I just wish it came with something other than windows 8. The update to windows 8 in October is worthless! So for now I will just keep using my XP laptop until I find a use for some or all the garbage windows 8 has in it. The computer it's self runs fast. Has every out io needed except a card reader.

Reviews.Title: Best for me
Reviews.Author: Seonggu Lee
Reviews.Content: Little bit heavy but excellent.Very thin than I think.LCD resolution is little bit disappointed but I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: jagadish kumar mahendran
Reviews.Content: The system is very slow. Cant stream videos, the system just hangs.Even when you are playing a video on a player, the system becomes slow.Even if I try to terminate a process, the task manager does not open quickly.Sometimes the system gets turned off automatically.Its definitely not worth money, I am shocked that it has I5 processors and is like this.

Reviews.Title: its already starting to do a few glitches
Reviews.Author: carl m hayes
Reviews.Content: one update took really long, windows eight takes a while to get use to.  i had to take the battery out already to stop it.

Reviews.Title: Good luck if you have a problem with this product.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ben"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product thinking I was getting a good deal. However, the CD player doesn't work at all. I get an error 19, and the driver won't install, and it won't work. So I trek on up to ASUS Web site to look for help... not a ding-dang thing. I try to fill out a support form. They want my serial number. I don't know where that is, so I click on the their link which is supposed to tell me how to find that... that link doesn't work. 404!So, now I have to replace it. But in order to replace it, I have to send it back, which means I'm out a computer for however many days/weeks it takes to get one back to me.This is my first experience with this company, and I intend for it to be my last.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i5 3337U 1.8 GHz
8 GB SO-DIMM
750 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS X550CA-DB51 15.6-Inch Laptop
